title: How do I stop Thunderbird switching between emails so I can select text?
content:
Hi there,

I recently switched to Thunderbird to track my multiple email accounts, but it is not letting me select text so I can copy-paste.

Each time I click and drag, it swipes to the next or previous email, depending on if I drag left or right.

I had a look through my settings but cannot find a way to stop it swiping to other emails. Double clicking to select the word and then the whole sentence does not work.

I had a dig through the Help Site but couldn't find a reference to this issue/setting.

How do I stop Thunderbird from swiping between emails so I can select text to copy?

Thanks :)

title: Trouble SENDING emails
content:
For the past few weeks I have been having a lot of trouble sending emails either as a new email or a reply or even accepting a calendar invite. The sending function pops up a box saying it is sending the email but the send times out after about 30 seconds. If I keep hitting the SEND button after each timeout it eventually works. Receiving new emails works without issue.

I am running a current Windows 10 pro using Thunderbird 128.4.2esr 64 bit with a basic Windows firewall and AVAST antivirus.

There are two different email providers, Gmail and Bell Sympatico, so I have two outgoing SMTP servers defined. This has been my setup for many years and I haven't knowingly changed anything in Thunderbird settings related to this issue. I think the last change I made was to set the OAUTH option for GMAIL a couple of years ago. I am attaching two screen shots to show the outgoing SMTP server settings.

title: How to keep email in Tbird but have Tbird NOT try to connect with that email account
content:
My first email was Hotmail n 1995.

Microsoft bought it a long while ago and made it a domain under their Outlook.

Now they are preventing any other app from downloading folders or emails from it, so I need to keep the emails that successfully made it into Tbird folders BUT avoid Tbird from ever trying to connect with it ever again (it hangs the whole app). They want users to be fully captured by their apps, and thereby to receive all fees and subscriptions, but they are careless and manipulative — arbitrarily blocking paid subscriptions, replacing preferred news source with their own, etc. — so I'm not going to sign up for anything not absolutely necessary (i.e. — for now — Word).

I am seeking guidance as to how to create just that situation. I did it 7..5 years ago when I retired, since the college where I taught immediately closed my email account there, but I can not figure out how to do it now.

Thanks in advance.

title: Problem w Thunderbird
content:
Good morning, We use the latest version of the Thunderbird email program. We've noticed an issue with displaying messages in the list. Detailed case description below

The problem occurs when sending @. When a user sends an e-mail, it is saved in the sent mailbox. The user enters the list of sent e-mails and sees an incorrect addressee in the to field - in most cases identical to the one in the previous e-mail sent. The content of the email is correct or displayed incomplete The problem does not occur with all emails sent, only randomly The problem is so troublesome that the user is misled by the program After rebuilding the folders in TB, the @ sent list is displayed correctly

title: Levél megnyitás
content: Ha a keresőből szeretnék megnyitni egy levelet, nem nyitja meg mindegyik részét, csak azt amit én küldtem el, a kapott válaszleveleket és az eredeti bejövő levelet nem. A levél megvan, a bejövőben megnyílik, de a keresőben csak a kimenő leveleket mutatja a csoportban ha megnyitom. pl. a keresőbe beírom, hogy alma. Kidobja az ehhez kapcsolódó leveleket, de ha meg akarom nyitni az egyiket, csak azt nyitja meg, amit én válaszként küldtem, az eredeti levelet és a tőlük kapott válaszokat nem. A levelek léteznek, a beérkezettben megtalálhatóak, de a sok levél között nem a legjobb megoldás mindig ott keresgélni. A keresőből nem nyílnak meg rendesen.

title: Eliminazione account
content:
Ciao e grazie in anticipo per l'aiuto. Descrivo per punti il mio problema:

-ho più account Thunderbird su di un PC Windows 11; -uno degli account era collegato con l'account aziendale Google (Gmail); -ho smesso di lavorare presso l'Istituto che mi aveva fornito l'account aziendale Gmail; -l'Istituto ha ovviamente disattivato il mio account e io non ho più la possibilità di accedervi; -ho eliminato l'account da Thunderbird; -appena apro Thunderbird, il programma mi chiede di scegliere quale account Google utilizzare; -questa richiesta mi si presenta con l'apertura di una finestra. In alto, in questa finestra, compare la scritta, preceduta dal logo Thunderbird: *(mio indirizzo email eliminato)* richiede un nome utente e una password; -il titolo della finestra è "Scegli un account"; sotto, mi compare il tasto dell'unico account Gmail rimasto; più sotto ancora, c'è un tasto con "aggiungi account". L'URL della finestra è https://accounts.google.comAccountChooser?oauth=1&continue= eccetera eccetera eccetera; -facendo clic sul tasto dell'unico account Gmail rimasto, ho concesso all'Mozilla Thunderbird Email l'accesso al mio Account Google, ma non è cambiato niente; -facendo clic sul tasto "aggiungi account", se provo ad aggiungere l'account eliminato ottengo ovviamente la risposta "account disattivato, rivolgersi alla propria azienda" (lo so, è un tentativo stupido); -fino a che questa finestra rimane aperta, non funziona l'invio della posta con l'unico account Gmail rimasto. Purtroppo ho scoperto dopo molti giorni che basta chiudere la finestra affinché Thunderbird possa continuare a funzionare correttamente :-( -la finestra mi si apre più volte durante una sessione di lavoro con Thunderbird :-(

Come posso fare per risolvere il problema? Ho idea che l'account aziendale mi sia stato disattivato scorrettamente. Ho provato a disinstallare Thunderbird e reinstallarlo, ma l'app... si ricorda tutto e sono punto e da capo. Ho consultato le Faq, ma, data la mia incapacità in materia (non sono un nativo digitale e questo potrebbe darvi un'idea della mia età), non sono riuscito a trovare soluzione. Grazie a chi mi risponderà! Carlo
creator: carlo.avossa

title: How to overcome recipient limit sending messages from Google Workspace account
content:
I am using Thunderbird for my Google Workspace Business Standard (GWBS) account because certain things, like navigation, searching, mail merge, and others are much nicer with TB than with the Gmail browser interface. I created the account in TB in the usual way, with no special tweaking of the settings. I routinely need to send messages to the 167 members of our program. The problem is that when I try to do so using TB, I get the error in the first attached image. The actual recipient limit for my GWBS account is 2000 per message, and there is no problem sending messages to 167 recipients using the Gmail web interface.

I chatted with GW support about this and was told by the agent that "you have added 167 recipients in a single email, by using a third party IMAP server you can only 100 recipient's. You can refer to this article https://support.google.com/a/answer/166852?product_name=UnuFlow&hl=en&visit_id=638669600328475265-236899981&rd=1&src=supportwidget0&hl=en". Here's a shortened version of that link: https://bit.ly/3UPAYWJ. I believe the part of that page the agent is referring to is in the second attached image, specifically the first one.

However, the server settings for this account in TB are the ones in the third image, which doesn't seem to me to be a third party IMAP server. Has anyone else come up with a solution for this problem. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

John E. Anderson, Executive Director, Jacksonville Joe Berg Seminars
creator: JoeBergSeminars

title: how to change/set default account to send emails including replys to local folder accounts.
content: I have a number of accounts putting mail into a "Local Folders" inbox. When sending a new email or replying the same account linked to local folders is always listed as the sending address even if I am replying to an email sent to a different address.Of course I can change to sending address but I would prefer it to use the sending address to which the original email was sent. I would also like a different default sending address to be used for a new message. In the accounts setting tab the address being used as the default has a gold star by its name. I assume that is the marker showing it is the default. How do I change this to a different account?

title: Delat in receiving emails
content:
When placing an order online, with Amazon for example, to verify ID a code is sent to my phone and is received instantly. Them a code is sent to my email address. I don't receive the email until much later that day or even the next day. Therefore, I can't complete the order, so all I have done is waste time. Is there something that has to be changed so that I can receive emails within a couple of minutes so I can resume ordering from Amazon. Temu and others?

Thank you

title: Problem to transfer mails between two Gmail accounts in Thunderbird
content:
Hello! I have two Gmail addresses, the main one [A] with very little space left, and a second, new one [B] almost empty where I'd like to archive a lot of the first address's emails and label them. I add them both to Thunderbird and subscribe to all folders, including "All Mail" and all labels/sub-folders. My process is to select a mail in the "All Mail" folder of [A], then move it (not copy) straight up into a label folder of [B]. This way, the mail doesn't exist anymore in [A], and only exists in [B], all of this done in one simple & quick operation.

After a few tryouts, I realize that if I use "Move To", or if I drag an drop an email from A to B, the mail is actually copied into B and still stays in A. I then have to delete it from A manually.

Is there any procedure that will allow me to cut/paste emails more easily between both accounts?

Thank you greatly, all! :-)
creator: jp.bensoussan

title: Opened Thunderbird No Emails
content: I opened Thunderbird and all my emails and email accounts are gone. It wants me to set up all over again. There is nothing there but a screen that says set up your email account with user name and password.

title: O Thunderbird não consegue enviar mensagens
content: Precisei instalar o Thunderbird novamente porque tive que formatar meu notebook e instalar tudo novamente. Depois de fazer todo o procedimento de backup e uma nova instalação, abri o Thunderbird e consegui receber as mensagens novamente após autorizar o aplicativo no Gmail. No entanto, não consigo enviar mais nenhuma mensagem por meio da mesma conta do Gmail. Aparece uma mensagem informando que a autenticação falhou. Já até tentei mudar de senha e a mesma coisa acontece: só recebo as mensagens por meio do Thunderbird, não consigo enviá-las. Meu sistema operacional é o Windows 11 e a minha versão do Thunderbird é a mais recente: 128.4.2esr
creator: crismjj

title: GIve thunderbird a n addressbook?
content:
I have contacts on my iPhone and Macbook Catalina. I have a newer PC (Lenovo Yoga one year old) but was using Mail until this fall; then I stopped having access to Mail or Outlook when new Outlook became the only supported mail app on my PC . I cannot open Outlook because I did not pay for a 365 subscription. I installed Thunderbird, but the PC will not admit to having an address book or contacts any more. I do have contacts in iCloud, and can open iCloud Drive on my PC, but contacts are not accessible through iCloud Drive directly but through iCloud and only through Outlook which is nonfunctioning. I do have iCloud sharing on for my contacts. After trying to import into THunderbird unsuccessfuly, I tried also dragging contacts out of iCLoud onto my desktop. But that ended up with a png file with a random seeming name. 

Even if there is no syncing I would like at least a one time transfer of my contacts to my PC, in a way that Thunderbird can use them. Any ideas - other than subscribing to365??
creator: true.patburke

title: 【Feature Request】Consider adding "SM4”
content:
For more: SM2 by ISO SM2 by ISO.

Advantages in brief:

1. Much less size (fixed size to 256 bits) only, compared with RSA (2048 or 4096 bits) and ECC (128-512 bits).

2. Much faster, compared with RSA in decryption/encryption, a little faster than ECC.

3. With encryption/decryption functions/key changing with each other.

4. Free to the public.

5. Safe in use.
